history.text: What do you think of the concept?  God allowing a man to take the reins from him for a little while.
Jim Carrey was a divisive pick for the lead, I think.
almighty is a movie where the main actor did not believe in god and comes to give a lesson, I thought it was very good
Did you find it more comical, or didactic, or both?
Did you consider it to be heretical at all?
It has a good concept because it mixes religion through comedy
I thought that was a unique approach, too.
How do you account for its poor ratings on Rotten Tomatoes and Metacritic?
Do you think it could happen in reality?
No, not at all.  And that's what makes it a fun concept to explore.
God would never allow a man to have those kind of powers, and rightfully so.
However, it makes a fun allegory.
It is inexplicable the low grades, it seems very good
I think the same, god would not give power to a simple mortal, it is a lot of power
Critical response is that its message gets "bogged down in treacle" - meaning cloying sentimentality.
I fear that's always a possibility with movies like this, but it wouldn't ruin the movie for me.
Even in the Bible, where God tests man, there is nothing comparable to him giving man such unbridled power.
you would like an new version?
I would be interested in reading the script, to see if it was worth making.
Definitely.
If I would like a new version
What other aspect of the movie did you like?
I like Morgan Freeman as God.
the way God appears and keeps the mystery is very good
a me too, is a good actor
What do you think about the system Bruce sets up to "automatically answer every prayer"?
I think it's interesting, but flawed from the beginning.
it seems a little crazy
I liked that the genre was comedy?
I think it's a bad idea.  Giving people what they want won't necessarily make them happy.
I agree.  I think comedy was a good route to tackle these questions.
It seems that Bruce learns a moral lesson from the whole ordeal.
The main idea was to make people think that God exists and that it is always necessary to pray and ask in a good way
I would agree that it should make people consider just how they ask their prayers.
Absolutely, I can learn the lesson
And deep down, that allows them to really engage in some introspection.
Which, I think, ultimately, is what God wants.
More so than just asking him for prayers -- he wants to see us use the free will we were given, to create a better life.
I agree with your opinion
Good chat.
